meanings.definition: The outer layer of bread or pastry.
meanings.sent1: I love the crispy crusts of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent2: She always cuts off the crusts of her sandwiches.
meanings.sent3: The crusts on the pie were so flaky and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The crusts of the pizza held all the toppings perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The crusts of the apple pie were golden brown and smelled amazing.

meanings.definition: A hard outer layer or covering.
meanings.sent1: The thick crusts of ice covered the lake in winter.
meanings.sent2: The old book had delicate gold leaf crusts on its cover.
meanings.sent3: The crusts of the ancient ruins protected the treasures inside.
meanings.sent4: The crusts of the volcano were solidified lava flows.
meanings.sent5: The crusts of the earth's crust can be very thick in some places.

meanings.definition: To form a hard outer layer.
meanings.sent1: The mud crusts over when it dries in the sun.
meanings.sent2: She carefully crusts the chicken before frying it.
meanings.sent3: The paint crusts on the old walls made them look textured.
meanings.sent4: The snow crusts on the ground after a few days of cold weather.
meanings.sent5: The saltwater crusts on the boat's deck as it dries in the sun.
